name: Wanderers
ideology: Movement is freedom. Borders are prisons. The world is larger than any faction's territory, and we've seen it all. Information wants to travel, and so do we.
history: Formed from nomadic groups, traveling traders, and refugees who never stopped moving. When territories hardened, Wanderers became the connective tissue—carrying news, goods, and people between isolated communities. They belong everywhere and nowhere.
structure: Loose kinship networks based on travel routes and trade partnerships. No hierarchy—reputation determines influence. Caravans form and dissolve based on need. The road is the only constant.
aesthetic: Layered, practical, portable. Faded colors from sun and dust. Everything serves multiple purposes. Pockets everywhere. Maps tattooed or memorized.

key_events.event: Refugee columns become first Wanderer caravans
Wanderer trade routes connect isolated settlements, become economic lifelines
Increased demand for Wanderer courier services between factions
Some territories restricting Wanderer movement—tensions rising

archetypes.description: Moves goods between communities, knows what's valuable where
archetypes.speech_pattern: Friendly, transactional. Always assessing value. 'What do you need? What can you offer?'

archetypes.description: Carries messages and small valuables, discretion guaranteed
archetypes.speech_pattern: Careful, professional. 'I deliver. I don't read. I don't remember.'

archetypes.description: Knows the safe paths, leads others through dangerous territory
archetypes.speech_pattern: Direct, observant. 'Stay close. Step where I step.'

archetypes.description: Carries news and culture between communities
archetypes.speech_pattern: Engaging, performative. 'Have you heard...?' Makes information memorable.

goals: Maintain freedom of movement across territories
Preserve knowledge of safe paths and shortcuts
Stay useful enough that no one wants to restrict them
methods: Trade information as readily as goods
Maintain strict neutrality to preserve access everywhere
Build relationships through reliability and discretion
Share enough to be valuable, keep enough to be necessary

current_tensions.about: Architects want to control movement. Wanderers exist to move freely.
Nexus tracks movement patterns. Wanderers value being untraceable.
Some Syndicate elements see Wanderers as easy targets. Others value the trade.
